item.description:
Bring chocolate!!!

What else do you need to know?

I could tell you about how the hike is going to take us up Mt. Greylock, Massachusetts' highest point, but I imagine you already know that. That it’s part of our Massachusetts Appalachian Trail Series started last season by John, our intrepid Odysseus, and that it is the 9th leg of a 10-leg odyssey, but I imagine you already know that too.

I could tell you how the Siren-ous Mt Greylock’s summit rests at 3491 feet, and at its summit we’re likely to run into throngs of people milling around the Veterans War Memorial Tower, but for all I know, you know that as well. I could also tell you, though I'm not so sure you want to know about the 14 long arduous miles, and the near 3000 feet of total elevation gain that may have us crashing onto the rocks by hike's end (or about how my Aunt Clara rests her lit cigarettes between her toes because she’s too lazy to hold ‘em in her hands), so I won’t… forget I said anything. What I will tell you is this, “bring chocolate!!!” Bring chocolate because without it, this is likely to turn into just another wonderful hike, thru another beautiful forest, over another majestic mountain, with another bunch of wonderful people looking for chocolate. And we certainly don’t want to know anything about that.

The Hike:

We’ll start with a “meet and greet” at the Pattison Rd. Trailhead (trail map), from which we will car spot and drive 30 mins. south to Ashuwillticook Rail Trail Trailhead (try saying that 5x fast!!!). From there we’ll set a brisk pace out of town (so fast people will think we’ve stolen something), and once safely across Outlook Ave., we’ll begin our hike in earnest, ascending approx. 1900’ over the next 4.7 miles before reaching the summit of Saddle Ball Mt. (3247).

We will then traverse a ridgeline, climbing another 250’ over the next 2 miles on our way to the summit of Greylock (3491). From there we’ll go the only we can, down. Over the next 5.4 miles, we’ll hike along Greylock’s northern ridge, descending past the summits of Mt Fitch (3110) & Mt Williams (2951), on our way to the Pattison Rd. Trailhead where we will find the cars and any chocolate we left behind.

Again, it is important to note that this is a long hike, one in which time goals must be kept in mind. [For time goals, please see Trail Route Information below.]


EQUIPMENT CHECKLIST

Cool Weather/Spring Essentials (required):
• Synthetic Quick-drying Pants
• Synthetic Quick-drying L/S Shirt
• Sturdy Hiking Boots/shoes (preferably waterproof)
• Synthetic/Wool Socks
• Insulated/Fleece Jacket
• Light/Mid-weight Insulating Layers (undershirt/underpants)
• Extra pair of Socks
• Hat/Gloves
• Rain/Soft Shell Jacket/Pants
• Water (2-3L)
• 65-70% Bittersweet Chocolate (preferably imported)
• Headlamp/Flashlight
• Map/Compass/Whistle
• Lunch
• Snack/Energy Food (extra food)


the Remaining Essentials:
• Medications/First Aid Supplies
• Sunscreen/Sunglasses/Bug Repellant/Toiletries
• Emergency Blanket (so small & light, there's hardly a reason not to have one in your pack)
• Fire (waterproof matches, lighter, starter)
• Repair Kit/Knife

Optional:
• Light-weight Wind Jacket (if your insulated or rain jacket isn’t windproof)
• Hand Warmers
• Trekking Poles
• Gaiters
• Light-weight Emergency Shelter
• Camera/Binoculars

 

Is This Hike for Me?

This is a lengthy hike over difficult terrain with some pretty decent elevation gains. We will have to move at good pace because of its length, so I ask that only experienced hikers in good physical condition sign up. We also may end up being a fairly large group (12+), increasing the chance that the group gets spread out, and in turn, slowing our pace, so please only sign up if you're confident you can fulfill the above request. Please bring plenty of water (I'm bringing 2-3 liters) appropriate hiking attire (no jeans or cotton clothing; wear hiking boots not sneakers), rain gear in case the weather turns nasty, lunch, and snacks. Do expect some muddy trails, and certainly do not expect to get out of this one with clean boots!

 

Trail Route Information (Time Goals):
(Starting from Ashuwillticook Rail Trail in Chesire)

0.6 mi. to Rt 8

3.5 mi. to Old Adams Rd (12:00PM)

3.0 mi. to Northend of Saddle Ball Mt (2:00PM)

1.2 mi. to Mt Greylock summit (3:00PM)*

2.3 mi. to Mt Williams summit (4:30PM)

0.9 mi. to Notch Rd

2.2 mi. to Pattison Rd (6:30PM)

* the closer to 2 or 2:30PM we can summit, the more comfortable our final miles will be.

 

 


Trailhead Directions:

From Providence 3 hours 10 minutes

From the intersection of Rt. 2 & Rt. 8 in North Adams, follow Rt. 2 west to the intersection of Notch Rd; turn left and follow Notch Rd, bearing right, as it turns into Pattison Rd; continue past Mt. Williams Reservoir trailhead parking is located on the right.

[The Google suggests a number of 3hr+ routes, the simplest looks to be the Rt. 91 North to Rt 2 West toward N. Adams route.]
